casebody.data:
No.-.

United States v. Ten Reels of a Motion Picture, entitled “Quiet Days in Clichy” (Grove Press, claimant).

D. C. C. D. Cal. Application to vacate stay heretofore issued by Mr. Justice Black denied, with leave to renew, however, if a trial on the obscenity vel non of this film has not commenced by August 3, 1970, unless any delay of the trial beyond that date has been occasioned by appellee Grove Press.

Mr. Justice Black and Mr. Justice Stewart would vacate the stay. Mr. Justice Douglas took no part in the consideration or decision of this application.
